comments.author: System ADMIN
comments.content: This term is taken from the Terminology Service

comments.author: felix engel
comments.content: Several other description (A), B), and C)) have been discussed during some of our meeting. Which description of "Demand" fits best in SC4EU? A) - Outgoing/ incoming Shipments (bound by capacity, mostly not directly forecasted, mostly historic values) B -  Outgoing (downstream)/ Incoming (upstream) Orders (already inflated and don’t reflect actual sales because of order cancellations) or C) - Confirmed orders.

comments.author: felix engel
comments.content: .. the recent definition originates from the Digital Reference Ontology

comments.author: felix engel
comments.content: the description is taken from WP5 sildes. Please propose other descriptions

comments.author: felix engel
comments.content: Descritption is taken from WP5 meeting slides

comments.author: felix engel
comments.content: Alternative descriptions are: A) - Can be calculated by dividing the current inventory by the average orders a day for the next months B) - Result is the reach in days (Reach, Inventory Coverage, Days of Inventory)

comments.author: felix engel
comments.content: I guess that "Desired Utilization Rate (DUR)" is rather a alternative label and "See Also". I have revised accordingly

comments.author: felix engel
comments.content:
NXP sees demand as incoming requested orders (inflated and biased by “panic buying”)
Expressed in absolute quantities (what we expect to ship). Slideset: WP5_26_06_2024

comments.author: felix engel
comments.content: I have added a definition that describes how I would define the term. Any feedback on it?

comments.author: felix engel
comments.content: It is somewhat lengthy, but as such hopefully explanatory

comments.author: felix engel
comments.content: I have put "Inventory Reach" and "Days of Inventory" as alternative labels (See Also it was previously)

comments.author: felix engel
comments.content: I have added the DR definition. However, Robert has proposed a more detailed description. PLease let me know which suits better: "Fabrication. In semiconductor manufacturing, fabrication usually refers to the front-end process of making devices and integrated circuits in semiconductor wafers, but does not include the package assembly (back-end) stages."
